translated: “At that time, on the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
The Fortunate One, the Seer of the Truth,
the Elder of the world, the Bull of a Man,
went out with a forest-going monk,
like a king of geese in the sky.
Homage to you, O Wise One among Men,
Having descended from the sky,🔽the one with great wisdom, the one with good intelligence,
having spread out his outer robe,

analyzed: vilīnam candana ādāya  agama asim jinantika
translated: Having melted down sandalwood,🔽I went into the presence of the Victor;
with a clear mind, full of joy,
I offered it to the Buddha.
Having paid homage to the Sambuddha,🔽the Elder of the world, the Bull of a Man,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
from here they went to the three,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā candanapūjanako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā candanapūjanakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Candanapūjanaka recited these verses.🔽The Story of the Elder Candanapūjanaka is the third.
